title: A proclamation, appointing a rendezvous of the militia-regiments in several shires, & calling out the heretors, &c.
author: Scotland. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James VII)
publisher: printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to His most sacred Majesty,
notes: "Militia to meet with best arms and 48 hours' provisions. ... All persons between 60 and 16 to repair to the rendezvous when beacons are fired." -- Steele.
At end of text: Given under Our signet at Edinburgh, the eighteenth day of September, one thousand six hundred and eighty eight years. And of our reign the fourth year.
Arms 237; Steele notation: Faith,  of  this.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C..
